alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 6:58PM EDT until May 04 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Faster flows along the river are expected but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river should continue to monitor later forecasts. High risks for recreational paddlers. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding as Moat Brook backs up and floods Transvale Road, cutting off access to a dozen homes and camps. Beaches at area camps flooded. At 8.0 feet, Flooding begins along the east bank campgrounds in Conway and North Conway. Campers along the river should move to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 9.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
